file_description: General rules for acquiring and using Feats in Star Wars Saga Edition.

acquiring_feats.at_character_creation: Each character gets one feat when the character is created (at 1st level). [cite: 538]

by_level_progression.description: Characters gain another feat at 3rd, 6th, 9th, 12th, 15th, and 18th character level (see Table 3-1: Experience and Level-Dependent Benefits, CRB page 37). [cite: 538]
by_level_progression.multiclass_note: For multiclass characters, feats are gained according to total character level, not individual class levels. [cite: 538]

bonus_feats: Heroic classes grant bonus feats chosen from special lists found in their class descriptions (see Chapter 3: Heroic Classes). [cite: 538]
Humans gain one bonus feat at 1st level, chosen from any feat the character qualifies for. [cite: 538]

prerequisites.general_rule: A character must have the listed ability score, feat, trained skill, or base attack bonus in order to select or use that feat. [cite: 539]
prerequisites.timing_of_acquisition: A character can gain a feat at the same level at which he or she gains the prerequisite(s). [cite: 539]
prerequisites.numerical_values_as_minimums: A prerequisite that contains a numerical value is a minimum; any value higher than the one given also meets the prerequisite. [cite: 539]
prerequisites.losing_prerequisites_effect: You can't use a feat if you've lost a prerequisite (e.g., if an ability score drops below the required minimum or another feat is lost). [cite: 539]
